physical_appearance:This is a low offering table. It has floral carvings and engravings along the front of the table. The back of the table has a semi-circular shape curving inwards. The tabletop has some slight scratches and stains.

sgcool_label_text:This low table with simple floral carvings and engravings was placed in the front of the altar sideboard and used as an additional offering table during important ceremonies. The back of the table has been modified to follow the semi-circular shape of the front of the sideboard. \r\n\r\nThis item is donated by the family of prominent Peranakan
 Ong Sam Leong (b. 1857
 Singapore – d. 7 February 1918
 Singapore). It comes from his ancestral home of Bukit Rose
 formerly at 259 Bukit Timah Road. Ong was a well-known successful businessman who made is money in the mining of phosphate on Christmas island
 which was historically a territory of colonial Singapore.

metadata.physical_appearance: This is a low offering table. It has floral carvings and engravings along the front of the table. The back of the table has a semi-circular shape curving inwards. The tabletop has some slight scratches and stains.

metadata.sgcool_label_text:
This low table with simple floral carvings and engravings was placed in the front of the altar sideboard and used as an additional offering table during important ceremonies. The back of the table has been modified to follow the semi-circular shape of the front of the sideboard. 

This item is donated by the family of prominent Peranakan, Ong Sam Leong (b. 1857, Singapore – d. 7 February 1918, Singapore). It comes from his ancestral home of Bukit Rose, formerly at 259 Bukit Timah Road. Ong was a well-known successful businessman who made is money in the mining of phosphate on Christmas island, which was historically a territory of colonial Singapore.
